alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; South Cass (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 7:54AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cass and west central Crow Wing Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 753 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pillager, or 16 miles west of Brainerd, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Nisswa and Gull Lake around 810 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pequot Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. This storm may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
